items.title: Metrologic Group and Horus Metrology Partnership
items.summary:
- Metrologic Group partners with Horus Metrology for enhanced *3D inspection and automation* solutions in Mexico.
- This alliance leverages Horus's local expertise and past successful collaborations to provide *customized services* for manufacturing.
- The partnership aims to meet increasing demands for optimizing *inspection processes* and manufacturing efficiency.

items.title: Introducing PCN24 for Nondestructive Testing
items.author: webmaster@bnpmedia.com (BNP Media Staff)
items.summary:
- The *PCN certification scheme* ensures the competence of NDT professionals globally, adapting to advances in technology and industry standards. 
- Launched in July 2024, *PCN24* is a third-party certification program by BINDT, accredited by UKAS, providing international recognition and flexibility for certified individuals. 
- The scheme emphasizes *quality* and consistency in NDT, updating its documents in line with the latest *BS EN ISO 9712* standards for training and certification.

items.title: Gleason Corporation Acquires Intra Group of Companies
items.summary:
- Gleason Corporation has acquired 100% of Intra Group, enhancing their gear metrology offerings.  
- The acquisition includes various entities across the US and UK, expanding Gleason's presence in key markets.  
- Leaders from both companies express excitement about future joint developments and seamless integration efforts.

items.title: Beyond Inspections: The Secret to Building a Quality-Driven Manufacturing Culture
items.author: marketing@gssmail.com (Adam Grabowski)
items.summary:
- Quality is a mindset, not just a department, essential for modern manufacturing.
- ERP systems shift quality from reactive inspections to proactive management, embedding it into daily operations.
- Implementing ERP enhances traceability, supports compliance, and transforms quality into a key competitive advantage.

items.title: Making Capability Studies Work for You
items.summary:
- Capability studies provide insights into process performance and control.
- Reliable data and process stability are crucial for meaningful capability indices like Cp and Cpk.
- Regularly conducting capability studies aids in identifying variations and implementing improvements.

items.title: Wire Terminal Testing and Onshoring: It’s All About Connections
items.author: Tyler Laravuso, Jennifer Redmond
items.summary:
- *Wire terminal testing* is crucial for ensuring the integrity of electrical connections in various industries, especially appliances, automotive, and aerospace.
- As companies increasingly focus on onshoring, wire terminal testing can help achieve *stability and quality* in manufacturing processes.
- Effective testing ensures that connections can withstand *mechanical stresses*, preventing failures and enhancing consumer safety.

items.title: Advancing Industrial 3D Printing with LFAM
items.author: Claudia Bortolotti
items.summary:
- *Large Format Additive Manufacturing (LFAM)* enhances production flexibility and reduces waste through *layered construction* of components.
- Implementing a comprehensive *Quality Management System (QMS)* ensures reliability, traceability, and compliance in LFAM processes.
- Sustainability plays a key role, integrating *environmental standards* which enhance the credibility and competitiveness of manufacturers in sectors that prioritize quality and eco-friendliness.

items.title: GE Appliances Reshoring Again!
items.summary:
- GE Appliances will invest *$490 million* to reshore production from China, creating *800 new jobs* by 2027.
- The reshoring movement, supported by classical economic rationale, has shown that U.S. manufacturing can be more cost-effective despite higher wages due to *inventory and delivery advantages*.
- This initiative aligns with a larger trend where over *2 million reshoring and foreign direct investment jobs* have been announced since 2010.

items.title: Cloud-Based Workflow Delivers Consistent Brand Colors
items.author: msiniak@datacolor.com (Maxim Siniak Ph.D.)
items.summary:
- **Accurate color reproduction** is crucial for brand recognition and quality perception, often hindered by inconsistent references.
- *Cloud-based color management* enhances communication and ensures a single system for all stakeholders, improving efficiency.
- Utilizing advanced technology can lead to **25-30% productivity improvements** and fewer production errors.

items.title: FRAMOS, Toradex Strengthen Partnership to Simplify Embedded Vision Development
items.summary:
- **FRAMOS and Toradex** have enhanced their partnership, creating seamless integration between FSM:GO optical sensor modules and Verdin iMX8M Plus SoM, simplifying embedded vision system development.
- This integration supports both the Yocto Project and Torizon, offering engineers validated camera modules, extensive documentation, demos, and joint support to reduce development time.
- The collaboration enables faster prototyping and faster time-to-market for AI-enabled edge applications, such as drones and industrial IoT, with long-term product availability guaranteed.

items.title: Maintaining Data Integrity in Color Management
items.author: Felix Schmollgruber
items.summary:
- *Color consistency* is crucial for product integrity and production efficiency. 
- Regular *calibration* and optimization of spectrophotometers help maintain data integrity. 
- Standardized *measurement protocols* across the supply chain ensure reliable color data and minimize quality control issues.

items.title: Wabtec Finalizes Acquisition of Evident’s Inspection Technologies Division
Rethinking Quality: Why Additive Manufacturing Must Grow Up to Move Forward
items.author: print@3dpeople.uk (Felix Manley and Sasha Bruml)
items.summary:
- *Quality* in additive manufacturing (AM) must evolve beyond cost and speed to focus on *repeatability*, surface finish, design validation, and reliable performance for production use.  
- Many AM bureaus still follow a *'print-and-ship'* model that compromises quality and customer trust, lacking preproduction consultation and design optimization.  
- To compete with traditional manufacturing, the AM industry needs an *industry-wide shift* in mindset prioritizing robust quality standards, collaboration, and comprehensive part finishing techniques.

items.title: Defining AI Literacy in Quality Management
items.author: Greg@800Compete.com (Greg Hutchins)
items.summary:
- The article discusses the imperative of *AI literacy* for quality professionals in the evolving work landscape. 
- It outlines four main opportunities for quality roles, including AI assurance and risk management systems. 
- Adapting to AI's disruption will enable quality professionals to thrive and redefine their contributions in the field.

items.title: Beyond the Factory Floor: Smarter Quality Control
items.author: media@faro.com (Daniel Teigman)
items.summary:
- The article discusses the transition from a labor-intensive manufacturing process to one driven by *advanced 3D technologies*, enhancing efficiency and quality control. 
- With *3D scanning and probing technologies*, manufacturers can reduce waste, improve accuracy, and foster a tech-savvy workforce to meet increasing demands. 
- The future of U.S. manufacturing aims to not only reclaim past glory but also *embrace innovation* for sustainable growth.

items.title: Ph.D. Graduate Develops Methods to Reduce Steel Defects
items.summary:
- New research from a Missouri S&T graduate aims to *reduce defects* in steel manufacturing processes.
- Dr. Kingsley Amatanweze's methods include an innovative *water-spray quench technique* for better cooling and fewer cracks.
- The study also explores *cleaner steel production* methods, enhancing material quality and sustainability.

items.title: Why Position Manufacturing Quality at the Center?
items.summary:
- *Francois Gau*, the guest, shares his extensive background in aerospace manufacturing, emphasizing the evolution in aircraft engine performance over decades.
- He discusses the increasing complexities and tighter tolerances in design and manufacturing processes that necessitate a focus on quality.
- The conversation highlights the importance of integration and consistency across various design software and manufacturing locations in the aerospace sector.

items.title: Quality Skills in Manufacturing
items.author: selandd@bnpmedia.com (Darryl Seland)
items.summary:
- The article discusses the value of *timeless skills* and training in manufacturing. 
- It emphasizes the importance of *specialized skills* for high school graduates entering the workforce. 
- Encouragement is given to expose youth to *enduring principles* of quality and lean manufacturing for future success.

items.title: Advancements in Industrial X-Ray Computed Tomography
items.author: Paul Brackman
items.summary:
- *Industrial X-Ray computed tomography (CT)* modernizes aerospace manufacturing by increasing inspection speed, repeatability, and defect detection accuracy, helping to address a historic backlog of over 17,000 unfilled aircraft orders.  
- Unlike legacy nondestructive evaluation (NDE) methods, digital X-ray CT efficiently captures *complete 3D data* requiring less skilled labor and automates defect detection with AI, increasing accuracy by up to 50%.  
- The resulting *digital twins* enable process improvement through data archiving, enhanced supplier traceability, and accelerated additive manufacturing workflows, positioning aerospace firms for a more agile, digitally integrated future.

items.title: The Role of Microtesters in Materials Testing Today
items.summary:
- *Microtesters* are essential for evaluating small specimens, excelling in applications like biomedical implants and advanced materials.
- They offer precise measurements at the micro scale, addressing limitations of traditional **Universal Testing Machines (UTMs)**.
- Upcoming advancements in *AI* and *additive manufacturing* promise to further enhance the value and capabilities of microtesters in research and industry.

items.title: Motivation at the Workplace
items.author: yves.vannuland@comatech.be (Yves Van Nuland PhD)
items.summary: - The article presents the Prima method to diagnose and improve **employee motivation** by identifying and addressing 20 common symptoms of poor motivation through structured team activities. - Motivation depends on the C.A.R. model: **Competence, Autonomy, and Relationships**, with a strong emphasis on constructive leadership behaviors that foster trust, appreciation, and collaboration. - Effective leadership transformation from **defensive to constructive thinking styles** has significant impact in overcoming motivational barriers and improving workplace culture with concrete, actionable plans.

items.title: AI in Quality Management: Hype vs. Reality
items.summary:
- While *AI* promises significant gains in manufacturing, many businesses are still unprepared for its adoption.
- Only 5% of manufacturing sectors have integrated AI, with numerous companies struggling to realize value from their efforts.
- A strong *digital foundation* and standardized processes are essential for AI to enhance quality management effectively.

items.title: Cost of Quality Implementation: A Practical Approach
items.author: htang2@emich.edu (Dr. Herman Tang)
items.summary:
- This article presents the *Cost of Quality (COQ)* concepts and two models: *Prevention-Appraisal-Failure* (PAF) and *Process Cost Model* (PCM).
- It emphasizes practical methods for categorizing COQ data using spreadsheets, benefiting small to mid-sized organizations.
- Implementing COQ principles can lead to cost reductions and improved quality through systematic tracking and analysis.

items.title: Kitov AI, FANUC America Announce Strategic Partnership in AI-Driven Smart Manufacturing
items.summary:
- FANUC America and Kitov AI have formed a strategic partnership to enhance *manufacturing automation* with AI solutions.
- The collaboration combines *FANUC's robotics* and *Kitov's machine vision*, aiming to improve *quality control* and *production efficiency*.
- Demonstrated live at the *OptiPro Open House*, this partnership seeks to redefine *smart manufacturing* through integrated technologies.

items.title: Cultivating an Innovation Mindset for Creativity, Quality and Progress
items.summary: - An *innovation mindset* is essential for progress, involving creative problem-solving, resilience, curiosity, and adapting to change, with tools like TRIZ aiding systematic innovation. - Embracing failure as feedback, fostering *psychological safety*, and applying principles like the Trimming Principle can drive transformation and quality improvement across industries. - Leadership commitment, continuous questioning, and reframing obstacles as opportunities are crucial to cultivating a culture of *innovation* and sustaining quality in a rapidly evolving world.

items.title: Best Practices for Nondestructive Testing in EV Batteries
items.author: thomas.parker@inficon.com (Thomas Parker)
items.summary:
- The rise of *electric vehicles* (EVs) necessitates rigorous testing of *battery packs* to ensure safety and reliability.
- The **Equivalent Channel Method** offers a nondestructive approach to test leak-tightness, aiming for standards like IEC 60529's IPX7.
- Using helium leak testing enhances *quality assurance*, allowing for early detection of potential failures while maintaining battery integrity.

items.title: Tariffs Trigger Shifts in Supply Chains and Quality Strategy
items.author: Genevieve Diesing
items.summary:
- Tariffs are accelerating U.S. manufacturers' reshoring efforts and increasing the complexity of supply chains, which drives a greater focus on *quality assurance* and automation investments.  
- Supply chain disruptions compel quality teams to take a central role in sourcing decisions, increasing oversight and demanding tighter inspection and validation processes.  
- Digital quality management systems and lean principles help companies maintain *stability* and adaptability amid rapid supplier changes, positioning quality assurance as a strategic lever during ongoing trade disruptions.

items.title: ISO 10012 Revision Update
items.author: jvdbd@hotmail.com (John Vandenbemden)
items.summary:
- The ISO 10012 standard is undergoing major revisions to move from a guideline format to a certification framework.
- The revision aims to enhance measurement management systems, making them crucial for consistent quality in products and services.
- Aiming for completion by June 1, 2025, the revision process involves extensive team collaboration to resolve feedback from the initial review.

items.title: Automated Calibration Systems Improve Manufacturing Accuracy
items.author: Genevieve Diesing
items.summary:
- *Automated calibration systems* enhance measurement accuracy by reducing manual processes and mistakes.
- Key innovations include *multi-laser systems* and *self-regulating handheld instruments*, significantly speeding up calibration while maintaining precision.
- Despite their benefits, companies must tackle challenges like *operator training*, *system integration*, and *data management* for successful implementation.

items.title: ‘Stressing’ the Importance of Quality in Manufacturing
items.summary:
- Patrick Jester shares how rapid corporate growth and increased responsibilities escalated his stress, affecting his health and work quality in the *quality management* field.
- He highlights a major industry trend where *quality budgets* are minimal until crises occur, then blamed for issues, emphasizing quality should be viewed as a *profit center* rather than a cost.
- The discussion calls for a mindset shift to recognize quality as a *value-add* that *defends profits* and improves business outcomes, not merely a cost or liability.

items.title: Medical Manufacturing Technologies Acquires Comco
items.summary:
- *Medical Manufacturing Technologies (MMT)* has acquired *Comco*, enhancing its microblasting capabilities.
- Comco is known for its *MicroBlaster®* technology, crucial for various industrial applications.
- This acquisition aims to innovate customer solutions while maintaining high product quality and support.

items.title: Advocating for U.S. Manufacturing and Quality
items.author: David Robinson
items.summary:
- **David Robinson** discusses the challenges facing small to medium-sized manufacturers in the U.S.
- There is a significant *skills gap* and uncertainty about the future of manufacturing in light of reshoring efforts.
- The proposed **American Manufacturing Renaissance Act** aims to allocate $12 billion to support manufacturing needs across various communities.

items.title: Calibrating Humidity for Data Centers
items.author: Abhishek Kamerkar
items.summary:
- Maintaining *optimal humidity* is crucial for the reliability of data center operations. 
- Inaccurate humidity sensor readings can lead to significant financial losses due to equipment damage and increased operational costs. 
- Regular calibration, whether *in-house* or outsourced, ensures compliance and protects against service level agreement breaches.
